alert.note: Alert for Irion; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 2:53PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Schleicher, southwestern Tom Green, eastern Crockett, northwestern Sutton and southern Irion Counties through 345 PM CST... At 252 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ozona, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ozona, Barnhart, The Intersection Of Us- 190 And Ranch Road 1828, The Intersection Of Us 190 And Highway 163, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2083 And Highway 405, The Intersection Of Highway 163 And Ranch Road 1973, I-10 Near The Crockett- Sutton County Line, Us-190 Near The Crockett- Sutton County Line and The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 405. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 350 and 385. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for west central Texas.
